reviews.title: My stay at Tierra Atacama
reviews.text: I stayed at Hotel Tierra Atacama for five days during July. The hotel offers helpful and accommodating service.. The facility itself is beautiful and very well tended. I believe that there is still work being done on the sauna/steamroom though at this point it may have been completed though I would have enjoyed using it while I was there ...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Tours for the following day are arranged the evening before and every effort is made to make sure that all of your interests are met even if it means arranging a solo tour with one of the guides -- all of whom are very professional, and knowledgeable! Kudos to Gonzalo and the wonderful Pamela!
reviews.title: Wonderful, best the desert can offer

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple

reviews.title: Lovely!

reviews.text: If you wish to walk to town it takes about 15 minutes and I advise doing so before nightfall as it is a long and dark route. I'm sure however, that if someone wished to be driven into town and picked up the staff would arrange it.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The treks were extremely well-organised, with friendly and knowledgeable guides. We did three varied treks ("valle de la luna", "cornisas", and the cactus one down the river gorge) in small groups of maximum four people plus guide. Each time they were well paced, and the guides provided water and dried fruit when needed, and Super8 chocolate bars at the end! We also enjoyed the excursions to the Salar de Atacama to see flamingoes (the only disappointment was that there weren´t thousands of birds as we had expected), and to the Tatio geysers, which was followed by a lovely dip in the thermal pools at Puritama on the return to the hotel. At short notice, for our last morning, Paula organised a very interesting visit to the old fortress and the town museum. One advantage of the small groups was the opportunity to meet other guests, and make new friends.
reviews.title: Unique experience

likes.disliked: — Be sure you don't suffer from altitude sickness, it's 8000 feet.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have chosen this hotel based on the reviews on this site and correspondence with Fiona Martin, Sales & Marketing Manager, who answered all our numberous questions - hopefully, for you and Fiona, some made it into their website's FAQ section.
reviews.title: Perfect to relax and indulge

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Most of our queries were related to the excursion package. After considering all the + of the "all in" package, we decided that for us, the best is to book accomodation with breakfast and to get guaranteed excursions with a local tour operator. The excursions by the hotel are a shared service extended to guests in accordance with their interests and logistical availabilities. We have met their group of four with a lovely and smiling guide at the Guatin canyon and have no doubt that their excursions are top notch.
reviews.title: Wonderful stay, great people !!

reviews.text: Our aim was to go up to the Salar of Talar, the Altiplanic Lagoons, the Arco Iris valley, the Puritama hotsprings and on horseback from the Rancho Cactus to the Paso de los Toros and through the Valle de la Muerte.
reviews.title: Perfection in the Atacama desert

reviews.text: As you will notice by our pictures, we liked the hotel and the spa. Regretfully, with our excursion program, we did not have enough time to extensively enjoy the spa. We recommend to plan half a day of leisure to watch the Andes from one of the chairs along the swimming pool, alternating with some jacuzzy and massage.
reviews.title: Explore nature in luxury

reviews.text: What you need to know is that the hotel is about 25 minutes on foot from the village center. The road might be hot during the day and is completely dark during the night.
